questions.text: A 34-year-old woman comes to the physician complaining of easy fatigability. She lives alone and works as an accountant. questions.text: A 52-year-old golfer presents to you with right shoulder pain that has started to interfere with his daily activities, such as getting dressed. Imaging studies suggest calcification of the supraspinatus tendon. Which of the following is most likely to provoke pain in this patient?

questions.text: False about epiglottis is?

options.label: B
options.text: Blood supply derived from superior thyroid artery

questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Develops from the 4th pharyngeal arch The epiglottis is a cartilaginous flap that covers the laryngeal inlet upon swallowing, composed of elastic cartilage The epiglottis has a lingual and laryngeal surface, the former is consistent with the oropharynx posteriorly, and is covered in non-keratinized stratified squamous epithelium The laryngeal surface consists of respiratory epithelium, which consists of pseudostratified ciliated epithelium The cartilage is posteriorly pitted by small mucous glands The epiglottis is one of the three large unpaired laryngeal cartilages , the other two being the book shaped thyroid and the signet ring shaped cricoid cartilages
  • • Develops from the 4th pharyngeal arch
  • • The epiglottis is a cartilaginous flap that covers the laryngeal inlet upon swallowing, composed of elastic cartilage
  • • The epiglottis has a lingual and laryngeal surface, the former is consistent with the oropharynx posteriorly, and is covered in non-keratinized stratified squamous epithelium
  • • The laryngeal surface consists of respiratory epithelium, which consists of pseudostratified ciliated epithelium
  • • The cartilage is posteriorly pitted by small mucous glands
  • • The epiglottis is one of the three large unpaired laryngeal cartilages , the other two being the book shaped thyroid and the signet ring shaped cricoid cartilages

questions.text: True statement(s) about parotid gland is?

options.label: C
options.text: Lymph nodes are embedded in the gland

options.label: D
options.text: Only benign tumours arise from parotid gland

questions.correct_answer: C. Lymph nodes are embedded in the gland
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Largest salivary gland Purely serous gland The facial nerve forms the parotid plexus within the gland and separates the glandular tissue partially into superficial and deep layers ("lobes"). Duct opens opposite upper 2nd molar Lymph nodes occur in the skin overlying the parotid gland (preauricular nodes) and in the substance of the gland Benign as well as malignant tumours may arise
  • • Largest salivary gland
  • • Purely serous gland
  • • The facial nerve forms the parotid plexus within the gland and separates the glandular tissue partially into superficial and deep layers ("lobes").
  • • Duct opens opposite upper 2nd molar
  • • Lymph nodes occur in the skin overlying the parotid gland (preauricular nodes) and in the substance of the gland
  • • Benign as well as malignant tumours may arise

questions.text: Five measurement of blood oxygen saturation taken in a fetus are: 67, 61, 56, 52 %. The highest value is most likely recorded in which of the following vessels?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Explanations:
  • • The fetal circulation differs considerably from the adult circulation. Oxygenated blood from the placenta is delivered to the fetus via the umbilical vein. Thus the umbilical vein has the highest oxygen content in the fetal circulation. (The Ligamentum teres is the remnant of the umbilical vein in the adult). Blood from the umbilical vein is first delivered to the liver, where it bypasses the hepatic circulation via the ductus venosus and enters the inferior vena cava (IVC). Thus, of the choices listed, the IVC has the highest oxygen content. From the IVC, blood is delivered to the heart where it is either pumped into the pulmonary circulation or crosses directly from the right heart to the left heart via the foramen ovale. A fraction of the blood pumped into the pulmonary circulation may bypass the lungs via the ductus arteriosus and pass directly into the descending aorta. From the aorta, blood circulates to all of the fetal tissues. Deoxygenated blood is delivered from the fetus back to the placenta by the paired umbilical arteries.

questions.text: A small DNA virus is described that has affinity for stratified squamous epithelium. The virus is most likely to affect which of the following respiratory structures?

Bronchi are lined with pseudostratified epithelium. As the airways continue distally, the epithelium changes. Which of the following features is last to disappear as the epithelium changes along the respiratory tube?

A 62-years-old man comes to the physician for evaluation of progressive exertional dyspnea. His past medical history is significant for pneumonia and hypertension. He has a 45-pack-year smoking history. On physical examination, breath sounds are decreased bilaterally and wheezes are heard. A CT scan of his chest is shown below. Which of the following cells most likely contributed to the development of this patient’s lung condition?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Explanation
  • • This patient’s heavy smoking history, exertional dyspnea, and dilated airspaces on CT scan are indicative of centriacinar emphysema. The pathogenesis of smoking induced emphysema begins with oxidative injury to the respiratory bronchioles and activation of resident alveolar macrophages by components of cigarette smoke. This is followed by inflammatory recruitment of neutrophils into the affected airspaces. Activated macrophages and neutrophils release proteases (eg, elastases cathepsins, matrix metalloproteinase) that degrade the extracellular matrix and also generate oxygen free radicals that impair the function of protease inhibitors (eg, α1-antitrypsin). The resultant protease-antiprotease imbalance leads to acinar wall destruction and irreversible airspace dilation distal to the terminal bronchioles. Excess protease activity is also implicated in panacinar emphysema (commonly seen with α1-antitrypsin deficiency).
  • • centriacinar emphysema.
  • • macrophages
  • • neutrophils
  • • proteases
  • • protease-antiprotease imbalance

Examination of the brain at autopsy shows enlargement of the lateral and third ventricles and a normal-sized fourth ventricle. Where is the most likely site of obstruction in this patient?
An infant born to a 22-year-old female has difficulty feeding because of an underdeveloped mandible. Development of which of the following structures is likely also impaired in this patient?

A 54-year-old male is brought to the emergency department by his wife after he began having difficulty speaking. On examination, the patient is able to state his first name and can correctly point to different body parts on command. When he is asked about the onset of his symptoms, he responds, "I... weak... morning..." and becomes very frustrated. This patient likely has a disease process affecting which of the following brain areas?

A 53-year-old male complains of a "strange feeling" in his right hand. On physical examination, there is loss of sensation over the 5th digit. Which of the following nerves has most likely been injured?

A 34-year-old female presents to your office with moderate hearing loss that she noticed several months ago. She also complains of a noise in her right ear that is very disturbing. Physical examination shows right-sided hearing loss, an asymmetric smile, and decreased corneal reflex in her right eye. This patient's condition suggests an intracranial mass located in which of the following locations?

options.label: A
options.text: Between the medulla and the cerebellar hemispheres

options.label: D
options.text: Between the cerebellum and the lateral pons

questions.correct_answer: D. Between the cerebellum and the lateral pons

questions.text: A 34-year-old male begins treatment with combination chemotherapy for Hodgkin's lymphoma Shortly thereafter, he experiences severe vomiting and requires intravenous fluid supplementation. Which of the following brain sites is responsible for his symptoms?
Which of the following is NOT a clinical manifestation of the lesion shown in the diagram?

options.label: A
options.text: Ipsilateral flaccid paralysis of medial rectus

options.label: B
options.text: Ipsilateral loss of pain and temperature from face

questions.correct_answer: B. Ipsilateral loss of pain and temperature from face

questions.text: Internal arcuate fibers of medulla comes from
Pathology of the given structure will lead to which of the following speech disorder:
Ligamentum denticulatum has how many pair of teeth like projections?
Anterior neuropore closes on

Nerve growth factor (NGF) may be responsible for the normal development of neural crest derivatives. An embryo deficient in NGF could generated developmental anomalies that may be associated with all the following except the

options.label: C
options.text: Chromaffin cells of the adrenal medulla

questions.text: Derivatives of alar plate are all except
Visual fibres are located in which of the following parts of internal capsule of cerebrum?
Straight sinus is formed by

options.label: A
options.text: Vein of Galen + Superior sagittal sinus

options.label: B
options.text: Vein of Galen + Inferior sagittal sinus

options.label: C
options.text: Superior sagittal sinus + Middle cerebral vein

questions.correct_answer: B. Vein of Galen + Inferior sagittal sinus

questions.text: Which of the following part of Internal capsule is associated with acoustic radiation.

Which of the following is not a part of Epithalamus-

Cerebellar connection to other parts of brain is projected through which cell –
Which of the following are unpaired vessels in CNS
Tract ABSENT in Superior Cerebellar peduncle?
Purkinje cell fibres from the cerebellum end in?
A patient presented with pain in right testes. Examination reveals bag of worms suggestive of varicocele. Right testicular vein drains into:
Stomach is supplied by:
Mediastinal surface of right lung is related to all except:

A 50-year-old female presents with chronic upper GI complaints. Upper GI endoscopty shows proliferating mass in the stomach and she was eventually diagnosed to have gastric carcinoma. During sugery, before approaching the stomach, lesser omentum is seen. Free edge of lesser omentum formed by:
Colon is supplied by all EXCEPT:
Which is not boundary of Calot’s triangle:
Anterior relations of right ureter are all EXCEPT:

options.label: D
options.text: Bifucation of right common iliac artery

questions.correct_answer: D. Bifucation of right common iliac artery

questions.text: Pudendal nerve block abolishes pain from:
Internal pudendal artery is a branch of:
questions.correct_answer: A. Anterior division of internal iliac

questions.text: A 63-year-old male with a history of stroke and resultant severe oropharyngeal dysphagia develops a right lower lobe pneumonia after an episode of vomiting. This type of aspiration pneumonia commonly affects the right lower lung lobe because:

options.label: A
options.text: The right main bronchus is longer than the left main bronchus

options.label: B
options.text: The right main bronchus is straighter than the left main bronchus

options.label: C
options.text: The right main bronchus is narrower than the left main bronchus

options.label: D
options.text: The right lower lobe receives a richer blood supply than the left lower lobe

questions.correct_answer: B. The right main bronchus is straighter than the left main bronchus

questions.text: A surgeon transplants a donor kidney into a 45-year-old patient with end-stage renal disease. The upper 1/3 of the ureter of the transplanted kidney is retained and attached to the recipient patient's bladder. However, soon after transplantation, the ureter becomes necrotic. Which of the following arteries is the major source of blood supply to the upper ureter?

A 62-year-old man comes to the physician complaining of double vision. He first noticed mild difficulty focusing his eyes about 3 weeks ago and his symptoms have progressively worsened. The patient's other medical problems include metastatic prostate cancer On neurologic examination, he is unable to adduct his left eye, and stimulation of the left comea does not elicit a corneal reflex. A lesion involving which of the following anatomical structures is most likely responsible for this patient's symptoms?

A 45-year-old patient presents with vague abdominal pain and undergoes CT imaging of the abdomen (see slide below). Which of the following labeled organs is supplied by an artery of the foregut although it is not a foregut derivative?

A 55-year-old history professor had been experiencing increasing pain in his right hand over the last few months. Additionally, he noticed that he was losing strength in his thumb. he asked the physician if his pain might have anything to do with extensive typing on his computer. The doctor ordered x-rays and an MRI-scan. After careful analysis of the radiological results, his doctor referred the man to an orthopedic specialist. The patient MOST likely suffers from which of the following conditions?

A 75-year-old man with a 40-pack-year history of smoking and hypercholesterolemia is diagnosed with severe atherosclerosis. Atherosclerotic occlusion of which of the following arteries would result in insufficient perfusion of the urinary bladder?
Most afferents to the cerebral cortex derive from the
True about primitive streak are all EXCEPT

All the following statements regarding the mandibular nerve are false except
Between the superior & middle constrictors passes -
Which of the following muscles is known as ths life saving muscle of the tongue?
Which of the following structures open in the inferior meatus?

During recovery from a gunshot wound of the right pelvis, the patient notices a lurch in his gait. When he lifts his left foot off of the ground, his pelvis dips down on the left side. The nerve that appears to have been injured is the

When the femur is fractured, the broken distal end often turns posteriorly to enter the popliteal fossa due to muscle traction. Because of its position deepest in the fossa, which structure is most vulnerable to laceration?
When, in few people, the common fibular nerve passes through the piriformis muscle, the nerve may be compressed. This would affect part of which muscle?

In a hunting accident, an arrow pierces the mid-calf of a hunter. A major artery is lacerated in the posterior leg, and you notice that the sole of his foot is cold and pale. The dorsum of the foot is warm and normally colored. The artery that seems to be injured is the
A patient complains of localized pain in a swollen lower calf and cannot strongly plantar flex his foot. What tendon may have ruptured?
If occlusion occurs at second part of axillary artery, blood flow is maintained by anastamosis between –

options.label: B
options.text: Circumflex scapular & posterior circumflex humeral artery

options.label: C
options.text: Deep branch of transverse cervical & subscapular artery.

questions.correct_answer: C. Deep branch of transverse cervical & subscapular artery.

questions.text: Cells which surround the oocyte in Graafian follicle are called?

While driving a motorcycle a young boy collided with a tree & was thrown on right shoulder. There was no fracture. His arm was medially rotated & forearm pronated. The following facts are correct except –

options.label: B
options.text: Lesion of C5 & C6 is present.

options.label: D
options.text: Supraspinatus, Infraspinatus, Biceps & Subclavius are paralysed.

questions.correct_answer: C. Median & ulnar nerves are affected.

questions.text: Physiologist conduct a study to identify the protein constituents present in normal pulmonary secretions. Bronchoalveolar lavage fluid obtained from a 34-years-old healthy volunteer is found to contain elastase. This enzyme is most likely derived from which of the following cells?
Primary auditory area is :
A midline cleft lip is due to the failure of fusion between:
Damage to Ulnar nerve at the wrist will spare -
True about radial nerve all except–

options.label: B
options.text: Nerve of extensor compartment of forearm

options.label: D
options.text: Anterior Interosseus nerve is a branch of it.

questions.correct_answer: D. Anterior Interosseus nerve is a branch of it.

questions.text: Boundaries of Koch triangle are all Except –

options.label: A
options.text: Base of septal leaflet of tricuspid valve,

options.label: B
options.text: Anterior margin of the opening of coronary sinus

questions.text: Boundaries of Quandragular space are all Except –
All of the following statements about the splenic artery are true except that it:

options.label: B
options.text: Is a branch of the celiac trunk

options.label: C
options.text: Has branches that anastomose freely within the spleen

options.label: D
options.text: Supplies the greater curvature of stomach

questions.correct_answer: C. Has branches that anastomose freely within the spleen

questions.text: Anal canal NOT supplied by:

A 75-year-old patient presents to the dermatologist with a 4 cm brown lesion on the right cheek (Figure A). The patient states that the lesion has been there for years but just recently began to change in appearance. She has noticed cracking and oozing from the lesion over the past few months. The lesion most likely originated from a cell derived from which germ cell line
True about hemiazygos vein are all except-

options.label: C
options.text: At T8 level drains into azygos vein

options.label: D
options.text: Formed by right lumbar azygos and right ascending lumbar veins

questions.correct_answer: D. Formed by right lumbar azygos and right ascending lumbar veins

questions.text: Froment’s sign is characteristically seen in-
Which cranial nerve is involved in formation of tympanic plexus-
Not a branch of anterior division of internal iliac artery-
Internal spermatic fascia is derived from-
Cell lining of common bile duct is:
Intercostal injection is given at-

options.label: C
options.text: In the center of the intercostal space

options.label: D
options.text: In anterior part of intercostal space

questions.correct_answer: A. Upper border of the rib

questions.text: Ligamentum teres hepatis is developed from-
Ligament which prevents spleen to fall in left iliac fossa-
Subclavian artery is divided by which muscle-
Medial branchopulmonary segment is a part of-
questions.correct_answer: D. Middle lobe of right lung

questions.text: Protective mechanism of inguinal canal-

Card test is done to check the function of:

A 59-year-old man comes to the physician because of diplopia and a drooping right eyelid. His symptoms began 1 day ago and have since worsened. Physical examination shows a dilated right pupil that is nonreactive to both light and accommodation. There is vertical and horizontal diplopia. When the patient is asked to stare straight ahead, the right eye is directed interiorly and laterally with respect to his left eye. Magnetic resonance imaging of the brain shows an aneurysm involving the right posterior communicating artery. Which of the following muscles is most likely to remain functionally intact in this pattern?
Bare area of liver is related to:
Structure passing through both greater and lesser sciatic foramen are all except:
Meralgia paresthesia is due to involvement of:
questions.correct_answer: A. Lateral cutaneous nerve of thigh

questions.text: Action of tibialis anterior:
Atrophy of intrinsic muscles of hand, sensory deficit on medial side of forearm and hand, and diminished radial pulse on turning the head on the affected side could be because of:
